question: The most effective contraceptive available is:
exp: - Amongst the choices, third generation is most effective with a failure rate of only 0. 2/HWY. PEARL INDEX OF DIFFERENT CONTRACEPTIONS: Male condoms 2-14 / HWY Female condoms 5-21 / HWY Centchroman 1. 84 - 2. 84 /HWY OCPs 0. 1 - 2 /HWY Sterilization 0. 1 / HWY Vaginal sponge 9-20 / HWY
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: In basal body temperature method, after the rise of temperature, the unsafe period lasts for:-
exp: - In BBT, the rise of temperature signifies ovulation. - Since maximum survival of ovum post ovulation is 3 days, the unsafe period is 3 days post rise of body temperature. Other natural methods of contraception are: Calender method / feile period method/ safe period method/ rhythm method Cervical mucus method Symptothermic method Coitus interruptus Abstinence - most effective method
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Absolute Contraindication for the Use of OCPs is:
exp: Absolute contraindications of OCP'S: - C - Cancers - L - Liver diseases - U - Uterine bleeding - T - Thromboembolism - C - Cardiovascular diseases - H - Hyperlipidemia - Preganancy Also remember, Long-standing or complicated diabetes (with microvascular complications) is absolute contraindication. Grade I hypertension is relative contraindication and Grade II is absolute. Simultaneous use of some anti-epileptics is relatively contraindicated.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: MC side effect of IUCD inseion:
exp: MC side effect bleeding (give to female iron tablet for 2 months). Pain is 2nd mc. but its mc cause of removal of IUCD.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Which of the following contraception method is contraindicated in women with epilepsy on treatment?
exp: OCP pills' metabolism is increased by some of the anti-epileptic drugs, hence use of OCP with these drugs is relatively contra-indicated.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Best contraceptive for a Newly married healthy couple:-
exp: Contraceptive choices for a newly married healthy couple Oral contraceptive pills - Low failure rate - Ideal method of choice for newly married healthy couple. Barrier method - Has a high failure rate; only consistent use for 2 years. - Has advantage of HIV/STI protection but a 'healthy' couple may not need it. IUCD - Is not a method of first choice for nulliparous female. Natural methods - Has a high failure rate.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: The Standard Days Method (SDM) advices on avoiding unprotected sexual intercourse:
exp: Standard days method: It is for the women having their cycle lengths between 26-31 days. Have their feile days between 8 to 19 days of cycle. Hence, SDM advices on avoiding unprotected sexual intercourse during these days of menstrual cycle.
opa: From day 3 to 13 of menstrual cycle.
opb: From day 8 to 28 of menstrual cycle
opc: From day 8 to 21 of menstrual cycle
opd: From day 3 to 19 of menstrual cycle
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: A woman takes very low dose combined oral contraceptive pills. After how many days of continuously missing to take pills minimum, there is failure of contraceptive method.
exp: Combined OCPs:- - Contain low doses of estrogen & progesteron. - They contain 0. 15 mg of Levo-norgesterol and 0. 03 mg of ethinyl estradiol. - With very low dose pills containing 20 mcg of less estrogen, the failure will happen after 2 or more missed pills.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Temporary contraceptive method of choice in a 37 yr well educated woman:
exp: Diaphragm: Is the BEST CHOICE in a 37 yr well educated woman. Diaphragm: It is a temporary method. Is immediately reversible. Requires a educated motivated woman. Is not associated with excess bleeding, PID. (unlike IUCDs) Gives additional protection against HIV/STIs. OCPs (Mala - N, Mala - D): Must preferably be used for spacing in younger women. Women above 35 years must go for other forms of contraception. Definitely not prescribed / used beyond 40 years age. IUCD: can also be used in the given situation.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: In a non-breastfeeding woman, use of Combined oral contraceptive pill during first three weeks following delivery is:-
exp: Use of OCP in breastfeeding women is absolutely contraindicated in first six weeks as it can completely suppress lactation. It is relatively contraindicated between six weeks to six months as it can decrease breast milk output by30%. It is relatively contraindicated even in non-breastfeeding women in first three weeks as it can increase the risk of DVT during the hyper-coagulation period of post-delivery. READ THE QUESTION CAREFULLY: NON-BRESTFEEDING
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Cu-T-380A IUCD should be replaced in:
exp: Cu-T 380A: - MC used IUD in India. - 380 is surface area of Cu in mm2 - A: Arm. - The effective lifespan of Cu-T 380A IUD is 12 years but approved for 10 years use, and it should be replaced after this time period.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Most effective contraceptive for a healthy newly married couple is:
exp: Combined OCP are best contraceptive for a newly married couple to delay first child bih as much as possoible
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Taking into consideration typical usage patterns, the most effective spacing method provided under National Family Planning program is-
exp: The most effective spacing method provided under National Family Planning program is CuT 380 A. Cu T 380 A has a failure rate of only 0. 6-0. 8/HWY, as compared to failure rate of Mala-N of 8/HWY and for condom of 10-14/HWY. NSV is not a spacing method.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Which of the following natural family planning method is most effective?
exp: Symptothermic method This method combines the temperature, cervical mucus and calendar techniques for identifying the feile period. If the woman cannot clearly interpret one sign, she can "double check" her interpretation with another. Therefore, this method is more effective than the "Billings method or cervical mucus method "
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Progesterone of choice in Emergency contraception is-
exp: Emergency contraception: - Aka intraceptive/ post-coital contraception - Methods of emergency contraception:- - Combined OCPs within 72hrs of unprotected intercourse - POPs within 72hrs of unprotected intercourse - Recommended in RCH LNG -based progesterone product is used for emergency contraception. It is used as 1 tablet of 0. 75 mg within 72 hrs of unprotected sex and second tablet after 12hrs of first dose - IUD within 5 days - most effective method - Contraindicated in nulliparous - RU-486(mifepristone)- within 72 hrs - High dose estrogen- within 5 days
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Hormonal contraceptives are contraindicated in women:
exp: - Combined oral contraceptives are absolutely contraindicated in those with Thrombo-embolic disorders. - They are useful in women with anemia, as they decrease the menstrual blood loss. Other Absolute CI of OCPs: Cancer Liver diseases Uterine bleeding Cardiovascular diseases Hyperlipidemia Pregnancy
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Contraceptive pill of choice in lactating female is:
exp: OCP are contraindicated in first six months of breastfeeding. Of the remaining methods, POP has the highest effectiveness. Progesterone only pills can be initiated after six weeks of delivery. POP with LAM has a failure rate with typical usage of only 1/HWY. - LAM (Lactational Amenorrhea) is a method, which will be functional in all women by default as exclusive breastfeeding is recommended for six months.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: In a woman using an intrauterine contraceptive device (IUCD) an intrauterine pregnancy occurs and the IUCD threads are visible. What is the reason to recommend removal of the device?
exp: - There is no teratogenic risk with a retained IUCD. - However, there may be an increased risk of infection and preterm labour. - Hence, it is recommend to remove the device.
opa: To prevent the risk of subsequent septic aboion and preterm labor
opb: To prevent congenital abnormality of the newborn
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Single pill of MALA-D contains:-
exp: - Depament of family welfare, in the ministry of Health & Family welfare, Government of India, has made available two types of low dose oral pills under the brand name Mala-D & Mala-N. - They contain 0. 15 mg of Levo-norgesterol and 0. 03 mg of ethinyl estradiol. - Mala - D is a package of 28 pills is made available to consumer under social marketting at the price of Rs. 3 per packet. - Mala -N is supplied free of cost through all PHCs, urban family welfare centers etc.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: Mala-N oral contraceptive pill differs from Mala-D, in terms of:-
exp: Mala-N Mala-D Type of contraceptive Combined OCP Combined OCP Estrogen Ethinyl estradiol Ethinyl estradiol Progesterone Norgestrel Desogestrel Status in RCH Provide free of cost Provided at a subsidized cost (Rs. 3/ per packet)
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: OCPs are absolutely contraindicated in:
exp: Contraindications to combined OCPs: Absolute contraindications Relative contraindications Cancer breast and genitals Liver disease Uterine bleeding (undiagnosed abnormal) Thromboembolism (past or current) Cardiac anomalies Hyperlipidemia (Congenital) [MNEMONIC: CLUTCH) Pregnancy Age > 40 years Age > 35 and smoking Mild hypertension Chronic renal disease Epilepsy Migraine 0-6 months lactating mother Diabetes mellitus Gall bladder disease History of infrequent beeding / amenorrhoea
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: A woman has her shoest cycles of 26 days and longest cycle of 31 days. Calculate her unsafe period using Rhythm method?
exp: Rhythm method: Aka calender method / safe period method / feile period method. Unsafe period = (Shoest cycle -18 days) to (longest cycle-10 days) Given shoest cycle = 26days; longest cycle = 31 days Unsafe period = to days = 8-21 days.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: The failure rate of Condom with typical use is:
exp: The failure rate of condom with Perfect use is 2 - 3/HWY Typical use is 10-14/HWY. PEARL INDEX OF DIFFERENT CONTRACEPTIONS: Male condoms - 2-14 / HWY Female condoms - 5-21 / HWY IUD - 1-5 / HWY OCPs - 0. 1 - 2 /HWY Sterilization 0. 1 / HWY Vaginal sponge - 9-20 / HWY - More effective method of sterilization is vasectomy > tubectomy.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: The highest incidence of ectopic pregnancy amongst contraceptive users is observed with:
exp: - There is a slight increase in propoion of ectopic pregnancy post-failure of IUCD. The failure is highest with progesterone IUD. Progestase intrauterine device: - Rate of progesteron release = 65 mcg/day - Total progesteron content = 38mg - Shelf life = 1 to yrs - MC side effect is bleeding - 2nd MC side effect - pain
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: During the first 6 months of lactation, which amongst the following contraceptives is not advisable?
exp: - Combined oral contraceptives are relatively contraindicated in the first six months of delivery, as they decrease breastmilk output. - Progestin-only methods can be used after 6 weeks of delivery safely as they have little to no effect on lactation post-six weeks.
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs

question: IUCD must not be used in a woman with-
exp: Pelvic tuberculosis is an absolute contraindication for IUD inseion. Absolute contraindications for IUD Relative contraindications for IUD Suspected Pregnancy PID Vaginal Bleeding of undiagnosed etiology Ca Cervix, Uterus or Adnexa and other pelvic tumours Previous Ectopic Pregnancy Anemia Menorrhagia History of PID since last pregnancy purulent cervical discharge Congenital uterine malformations Unmotivated person
opa: Genital herpes with severe non-purulent discharge
topic_name: Natural Methods, Barrier Methods, IUDs, OCPs
